div.div: This site offers a small REST API to perform arbitrary PEPPOL SMP lookups with a JSON result. The API is proprietary. The result data format is proprietary JSON.

li.a: SMP query all document types of a participant
SMP query all endpoints of a participant for a certain document type
SMP query the Business Card of a participant
Convert EN 16931 CII to EN 16931 UBL documents

div: The base URL for all REST queries is https://peppol.helger.com/api - prepend this to all queries.
If an SML is required, the following SML identifiers are available:

ul.li: digittest - the test PEPPOL SML (aka SMK)
id40 - the pilot TOOP SML (aka SMK)
autodetect - find the matching SML automatically

h2: API: SMP query all document types of a participant
p: To retrieve all document types from a participant registered in an SMP.
div:
SML-ID is the SML identifier mentioned above.
participant-ID is the URL encoded participant identifier to be queried (e.g. iso6523-actorid-upis%3a%3a9915%3atest)
If the optional parameter businessCard=true is added, the SMP Business Card is queried as well.
p: Note: all SMP queries are passed through to the effective SMP server and cause load there.
h2: API: SMP query all endpoints of a participant for a certain document type
p: To retrieve all endpoints of an SMP participant for a single document type. This API gives you AS2 and AS4 endpoints.
div:
SML-ID is the SML identifier mentioned above.
participant-ID is the URL encoded participant identifier to be queried (e.g. iso6523-actorid-upis%3a%3a9915%3atest)
docType-ID is the URL encoded document type identifier to be queried (e.g. busdox-docid-qns%3A%3Aurn%3Aoasis%3Anames%3Aspecification%3Aubl%3Aschema%3Axsd%3AInvoice-2%3A%3AInvoice%23%23urn%3Awww.cenbii.eu%3Atransaction%3Abiitrns010%3Aver2.0%3Aextended%3Aurn%3Awww.peppol.eu%3Abis%3Apeppol5a%3Aver2.0%3A%3A2.1)
p: Note: all SMP queries are passed through to the effective SMP server and cause load there.
h2: API: SMP query the Business Card of a participant
p: To retrieve the Business Card of a participant stored in an SMP.
div:
SML-ID is the SML identifier mentioned above.
participant-ID is the URL encoded participant identifier to be queried (e.g. iso6523-actorid-upis%3a%3a9915%3atest)
p: Note: the layout of the BusinessCard JSON is identical to the one used in querying all document types of a participant.
Note: all SMP queries are passed through to the effective SMP server and cause load there.
h2: API: Convert EN 16931 CII to EN 16931 UBL documents
p: To automatically convert EN 16931 CII D16B documents to EN 16931 UBL 2.1 documents, based on https://github.com/phax/en16931-cii2ubl.
div:
The CII document to be converted must be the payload of the request.
The URL parameter simple-response can be used to "only" return the UBL document and no additional detail. Possible values are true and false.
The URL parameter xml-beautify can be used to format (indent) the resulting UBL document. Possible values are true and false.
p: Note: the request header Content-Type MUST be set to text/xml or application/xml.

Example curl call to convert the local file "CII_example2.xml":
curl -X POST "https://peppol.helger.com/api/convert/cii2ubl?simple-response=true&xml-beautify=true" --data @CII_example2.xml --header "Content-Type: application/xml"
